summary.text: An object that is used to describe an attachment that is included with a SMS message.
The mime type of the attachment such as

The content URI of the attachment. The URI needs be a content URI so that it can be accessed by
other applications outside of Expo. See [FileSystem.getContentUriAsync](
Status of SMS action invoked by the user.
Determines whether SMS is available. Always returns
in the iOS simulator, and in browser.

content.text: Returns a promise that fulfils with a
, indicating whether SMS is available on this device.

summary.text: Opens the default UI/app for sending SMS messages with prefilled addresses and message.

content.text:
Returns a Promise that fulfils with the SMS action is invoked by the user, with corresponding result:
- If the user cancelled the SMS sending process:

.
- If the user has sent/scheduled message for sending:

.
- If the status of the SMS message cannot be determined:

.

Android does not provide information about the status of the SMS message, so on Android devices
the Promise will always resolve with

.

> Note: The only feedback collected by this module is whether any message has been sent. That
means we do not check actual content of message nor recipients list.

summary.text:
An array of addresses (phone numbers) or single address passed as strings. Those
would appear as recipients of the prepared message.
object defining additional SMS configuration options.
